div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of CHIN SHEUNG WING, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.} No. 3072 RETURN
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington:

Now comes the respondent, Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at the port of Seattle, and for answer to the writ of habeas corpus herein, says that he here produces the body of the said Chin Sheung Wing, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction thereof, and for further return and answer to said writ, here avers that he detained in his custody the body of the said Chin Sheung Wing for deportation from the United States, as an alien and Chinese person not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, under and by virtue of an order of the Secretary of Commerce and Labor of the United States, issued to him, said respondent, on July 6, 1915, which said order is in the words and figures following, that is to say:
DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE AND LABOR Bureau of Immigration and Naturalization In Answering refer Washington to No.53902/118 July 6, 1915.

Acknowledging the receipt of your letter of the 14th ult., No. 32537, forwarding record on appeal in the case of Chin Sheung Wing, the Bureau had to advise you that, after careful consideration of the evidence presented in the record, the Secretary has affirmed your excluding decision and directed deportation. Respectfully, A. Caminetti, Commissioner-General
Respondent attaches hereto the record, decision, and exhibits, both on the hearing before said Commissioner and on appeal to the Secretary of Labor, which constitute a part of this return.
And now this respondent having fully answered, prays that the said writ may be discharged and that he may be awarded his costs about his return to the writ aforesaid in this behalf expended.
Henry M. White Commissioner of Immigration
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION} ss.

Henry M. White, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigra- tion named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24 day of July, 1915. Albert Woodie Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. Northern DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Appli- cation of CHIN SHEUNG WING, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
